item.title: Seeing and hearing incense burn from up close feels like soothing rain
item.description:
Seeing and hearing incense burn from up close feels like soothing rain

It's a little brain jiggling to watch this macro footage of incense burning because you're seeing fire disintegrate the burning light but hear a pitter patter that resembles rain fall. And what the most backwards thing is that the strongest sense of incense-the smell, duh-can't be felt.

item.title: Watch this cool first person view of hand making a knife
item.description:
Watch this cool first person view of hand making a knife

Here's a really cool video showing the daily routine of Chelsea Miller, a knife maker. It's fun because it's filmed from her perspective so you get to see what it really takes. Fiercely Curious, who made the video, writes, "Chelsea Miller hand makes stunning knives out of old horse rasp files.
